schemes.timeline: The online application will be available at the beginning of the academic year, generally in March/April.
schemes.entitlements:
1. 3% reservation for Persons with Disabilities among Economically Weaker Sections/Disadvantaged Group in private schools
  2. Free books,uniforms and writing material to be provided by the school.
  3. Facility of a special educator
schemes.eligibilityRequirement:
1. 40% or more disability in 21 conditions as defined by Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016
  2. The age criteria for children with disabilities for pre-school/nursery, pre-primary/KG, & Class I as follows:
    Pre-school/nursery - 3-9yrs
    Pre-primary/KG - 4-9 yrs
    Class I - 5-9 yrs.
  3. Maximum family income: Rs 8 lakh per annum

    • CWSN-friendly functional toilet seats

schemes.heading: CBSE concessions and provisions for Children with Special Needs
schemes.timeline:
1. Schools will inform to the PWD candidates about exemptions/concessions extended by CBSE during annual examinations; Schools will make a list of PWD students after submitting LOC: At the beginning of the academic session.
  2. School will communicate CBSE approval to student approx by end of the August month.
schemes.entitlements:
Provisions related to Scribes/Readers:
  1. The candidates can get their own scribe/reader (qualification one step below that of the candidate) or ask the examination centre (qualification not to be more than the minimum qualification criteria of the examination, however, the qualification should always be matriculation or above).
  2. The candidate opting for own scribe must fill the form provided here. and submit it with school authority.
  3. The candidate can take different scribe/reader for writing different papers but only one scribe per subject.

Provisions related to Compensatory Time:
  1. Compensatory time for paper of 3 hours duration: 60 minutes
  2. Compensatory time for paper of 2½ hours duration: 50 minutes
  3. Compensatory time for paper of 2 hours duration: 40 minutes
  4. Compensatory time for paper of 1½ hours duration: 30 minutes
Other provisions:
  1. Magnifying glass/Portable video magnifier is allowed to visually impaired candidates
  2. Computer is permissible for typing answers, listening to questions and viewing questions in enlarged font
  3. Relaxation in attendance is allowed for certain categories of disabilities for further detail click link
  4. Registration and Examination fee for classes IX to XII will not be charged from visually impaired candidates
Specific concessions for Class 10:
  1. Can have an option of studying one compulsory language as opposed to two.
  2. Besides one language any four from amongst the following groups can be offered:
    -Group 1: Mathematics, Science, Social Science, another language, Music (Any one), Painting, Home Science, Elements of Business, Elements of Book Keeping and Accountancy, Computer Applications
    -Group 2: Any one skill subject (except automotive) for regular candidates only
    Note: Information Technology from Group 2 cannot be offered if Computer Applications from Group 1 is opted.
  3. Physio-therapeutic exercises are considered as equivalent to Health and Physical Education
  4. Separate questions will be provided for students with visual impairment in question with visual inputs in Social Sciences
Specific concessions for Class 12:
  1. A Person With Disability, as defined under the RPWD Act 2016, has the option of choosing Music (Any one), Painting, Home Science as the subject of study.
  2. For practicals in the subjects of Physics, Chemistry and Biology an assessment containing multiple-choice questions are administered for PWD.
  3. Question papers administered in Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and Biology are without any visual input
  4. lternative questions are provided for questions with visual inputs in History, Geography and Economics

schemes.applicationProcess:
1. For availing any exemption, parents will have to make a request to school, through a written application link along with copy of certificate of disability. The School will acknowledge the request made by the candidate.

schemes.documentRequired:
The photocopies of these documents are to be attached with the application and the original is to be brought at the time of submission of same for verification
  1. Any one of the following documents for verification of income:
    • National food security card
    • Income Certificate
  2. Any one of the following documents for verification of bonafide residency for the last 3 years:
    • Domicile certificate issued from area Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM)
    • Ration card
    • Voter ID
    • Driving License
    • Extract from the electoral roll
    • Aadhar card
    Note: In case the patient is a minor, the birth certificate of the patient and the domicile proof of either of the parents (any one of the aforementioned documents)
  3. Original estimate certificate issued by the treating doctor indicating the patient’s disease and the treatment required along with the estimated expenditure of the treatment duly certified by the medical superintendent
  4. Two photographs of the concerned patient, duly attested by the treating doctor of the hospital
  5. Photocopies of the treatment record
  6. An affidavit for signature verification as given in the application form
schemes.applicationProcess:
Application form to be filled by the patient or through his representative alongwith the above mentioned documents in person at following address:
Delhi Government Dispensary Building,
S-1, 3rd Floor, School Block, Shakarpur, Delhi - 110092
OR In the O/o Medical Superintendent/ Medical Director of the concerned Government Hospital

PROCESSING OF AN APPLICATION
  1. A complete application form alongwith all the requisite documents is processed by the concerned hospital and sent to Director General Health Services through e-office for his approval.
  2. Thereafter, the application needs approval from the Finance Department, GNCTD and is thence forwarded to Chairman, DAK for their approvals, respectively.
  3. Financial Assistance upto Rs. 25000/- is sanctioned at the level of DGHS, upto Rs. 1.5 lakh is sanctioned at the level of DGHS after approval of finance department.
  4. Financial Assistance above Rs. 1.5 lakh upto Rs. 5 lakh is sanctioned at the level of Chairman, DAK
  5. After the due approvals from the competent authority on rotation, the application comes back to Patient Welfare Cell and a sanctioned amount is issued in favour of the concerned Government Hospital through ECS facility.
  6. The concerned hospital is informed regarding the patient and the sanctioned amount for further necessary action at the level of hospital.
  7. The applicant, too, is informed through letter sent by Speed-post and, if contact number is available, telephonically.

schemes.heading: Assistance to Disabled Persons for Purchase/ Fitting of Aids and Appliances (ADIP)
schemes.timeline: Applications are accepted on a rolling basis
schemes.entitlements:
1. For income upto Rs 22,500 full assistance for the cost of aids and appliances will be provided
  2. For income between Rs 22,501-30,000 assistance of 50% of the cost of aids and appliances will be provided
  3. The list of types of aids and appliances is provided here.
  4. Travelling cost would be admissible separately to the PwD and one escort limited to bus fare or railway, subject to a limit of Rs. 250/- each person, irrespective of number of visits to the centre.
  5. Boarding and lodging expenses at the rate of Rs. 100/- per day for a maximum duration of 15 days would be admissible for patients as well as one escort/attendant only for those whose total income is upto Rs 22,500/- per month. Boarding and lodging expenses will be admissible for the following -
    • To attend the camp for receiving aids and assistive devices
    • Locomotor: Corrective/reconstructive surgery, cases requiring stay for fitment of artificial limb/caliper
    • Hearing: Cases requiring stay for ear mould fabrication/fitment
  6. Essential medical/surgical correction needed prior to fitment of aids/appliances will be provided as follows
    • Rs 1,500/- for hearing & speech impaired.
    • Rs 3,000/- for the visually disabled.
    • Rs 15,000/- for orthopedically disabled.
schemes.eligibilityRequirement:
1. An Indian citizen of any age.
  2. Holds a 40% Disability Certificate.
  3. Has monthly income from all sources not exceeding Rs. 30,000/- per month.
  4. In the case of dependents, the income of parents/guardians should not exceed Rs. 30,000/- per month.

schemes.heading: Income Tax Rebate for Individuals who have Disabled Dependants under Section 80 DD
schemes.timeline: As per the Income Tax Act, a person is required to file his/her return in the relevant assessment year by July 31 (unless deadline extended) to claim the refund. The FY immediately succeeding a financial year is the relevant assessment year (AY) for that FY.
schemes.entitlements:
1. Dependent person with disability – A dependent person with disability is one who has at least 40% of any of the specified disabilities. The family member who takes care of the medical charges of the dependent person with disability can claim tax deduction of up to Rs. 75,000.
  2. Dependent person with severe disability – A dependent person with severe disability is one who has at least 80% of any disability. The family member handling the medical expenses of a dependent person with severe disability can claim tax deduction of up to Rs. 1,25,000.
schemes.eligibilityRequirement:
1. Any person who is a part of the Hindu Undivided Family (HUF) and has a disabled person as a dependent can claim this deduction.
  2. The taxpayer has borne expenses for medical treatment and training & rehabilitation of the dependent with disability or the taxpayer has paid premium for a specific insurance policy designed for such cases.
  3. The taxpayer cannot claim this deduction if the dependant has already claimed deduction under Section 80U for himself or herself.
  4. The disabled individual is wholly or to a large extent dependent on the taxpayer for their support.

schemes.heading: Quota and concessions in Indian railways
schemes.timeline: Applications are accepted on a rolling basis
schemes.entitlements:
For PWD Reservation
  1. A reservation quota of two sleeper class berths in all trains running on non-suburban sections for handicapped persons with handicapped concession tickets. The escort is also allotted the berth out of this quota.
  2. In sub-urban trains, separate accommodation for handicapped persons has been earmarked.
Fare Concessions
  1. Orthopedically Handicapped / Paraplegic, Intellectually Disabled persons, Blind persons travelling for any purpose.
    • 75% in Second, Sleeper, First, AC Chair Car and AC 3 tier.
    • 50% in First Class and AC 2 tier
    • 25% in AC 3 tier & AC Chair Car of Rajdhani / Shatabdi trains.
    • 50% in Monthly Season Ticket & Quarterly Season Ticket.
    • One escort is also eligible for the same element of concession.
  2. For Deaf & Dumb persons (both afflictions together in the same person) traveling for any purpose.
    • 50% in Second class, Sleeper, First class
    • 50% in Monthly Season Ticket & Quarterly Season Ticket.
    • One escort is also eligible for same element of concession
For Patients
  1. Thalassemia patients traveling for treatment/periodic check-up
    • 75% in Second, Sleeper, First, AC Chair Car and AC 3 tier
    • 50% in 1AC & 2AC
    • One escort is also eligible for same element of concession
  2. Haemophilia Patients - severe & moderate form of disease for treatment/periodical check-up.
    • 75% in 2nd class, Sleeper, 1st class, 3AC, AC chair car
    • One escort is also eligible for same element of concession
  3. For Non-infectious Leprosy patients - for treatment/periodic checkup
    • 75% in 2nd class, Sleeper, 1st class
    • One escort is also eligible for same element of concession
  4. Sickle Cell Anaemia patients travelling for treatment/periodical check-up to recognized hospitals by Mail/Express Trains.
    • 50% in basic fares of Sleeper, AC-2-tier, 3AC, AC chair car classes.
schemes.eligibilityRequirement:
For PWD
  1. Orthopedically Handicapped/Paraplegic persons travelling alone or with an escort for any purpose
  2. Persons with severe intellectual disability who are travelling alone or with escort for any purpose
  3. Blind persons travelling alone or with an escort for any purpose
  4. Deaf & Dumb persons (both afflictions together in the same person) traveling alone or with an escort for any purpose
For Patients
  1. Thalassemia patients traveling alone or with an escort for treatment/periodic check-up
  2. Haemophilia Patients - severe & moderate form of disease - travelling alone or with an escort for treatment/periodical check-up
  3. Non-infectious Leprosy patients for treatment/periodic checkup
  4. Patients suffering from Sickle Cell Anaemia travelling for treatment/periodical check-up to recognized hospitals by Mail/Express Trains
